definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: The president will address the crowd at nine o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 總統將在9點向大衆致詞。

sentences.english: Mr. Netanyahu spoke to Israelis in a Jewish New Year's address.
sentences.chinese: 內塔尼亞胡向以色列人發表猶太新年致詞。

sentences.english: Legislative Yuan Chair Mr. Wang Jinping gentleman, and delivers a speech.
sentences.chinese: 立法院院長王金平先生先生，並致詞。

sentences.english: Next let's have OCT Properties president Mr. Zhang Liyong here to give a speech.
sentences.chinese: 接下來我們請華僑城地產總裁張立勇先生致詞。

sentences.english: After the inspection, the two leaders made some remarks respectively.
sentences.chinese: 在檢閱了儀仗隊後，兩國領導人先後致詞。

sentences.english: Legislative Yuan Vice-President Mr. Jiang Bingkun, and delivers a speech the congratulation.
sentences.chinese: 立法院副院長江丙坤先生，並致詞祝賀。

sentences.english: Qinmindang President Mr. Song Chuyu, and delivers a speech the congratulation.
sentences.chinese: 親民黨主席宋楚瑜先生，並致詞祝賀。

sentences.english: H. E. Mr. Wang Wenzhang delivers a speech at the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 王文章副部長在開幕式上致詞。

sentences.english: The representative of New York State Senator Allen Young delivers speech.
sentences.chinese: 紐約州議員楊愛仁的代表致詞。

sentences.english: Please welcome Mr. Hu Heng, Vice-chairman of the People' s Government of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.
sentences.chinese: 請廣西壯族自治區人民政府副主席吳恆先生致詞。

sentences.english: Chairman of Kuching High Rebuilding Committee, Mr Kuek Eng Mong, giving speech.
sentences.chinese: 古晉中學重建委員會主席郭應茂先生致詞。

definition: to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
president of a club, committee etc
